conclusion: Analyze the flow of liquid through the depicted channels and baffles to predict which container (D or E) it will flow into.
The image shows several colored channels labeled A, B, C, D, and E, each with arrows indicating the direction of flow.
The baffles are labeled A, B, and C, where the flow of liquid will be obstructed.
Observe the direction of the arrows (flow) through each baffle.
From point A, observe the direction of the liquid flow.
Determine the direction of the arrow from A to D.
Since the arrow from A points towards D, the liquid will flow into D.
